maml:description.maml:para: This function approves a pending request.
Running this command requires on the one hand the ID of the pending request as well as the hash table containing all the properties.

maml:Description.maml:para: Token to authenticate to Alero.
Unique identifier of the request.
Self Service Invitation body. Fill out all properties
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Token to authenticate to Alero.
Self Service Invitation body. Fill out all properties
Unique identifier of the request.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The request body must contain all the properties. The information can be found in the official documentation.

maml:description.maml:para: This command rejects a pending request.
This command rejects a pending request.

maml:description.maml:para: This function edits the description of an existing Alero group.
Only the description of an Alero group can be edited once the group is created. If the name should be edited, the group has to be created.

maml:Description.maml:para: Token to authenticate to Alero.
The unique ID of the AleroLDAP group.
The description of the AleroLDAP group
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Token to authenticate to Alero.
The description of the AleroLDAP group
The unique ID of the AleroLDAP group.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Edit-AleroGroup -Authn $auth -GroupId j1h42k3j4h2kb1h12v3bj -Description "This is a new description."

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command sets the new description of the existing group.

maml:description.maml:para: This function edits the status of an existing Alero user.
So far only the status of the specified Alero user can be edited.

maml:Description.maml:para: Token to authenticate to Alero.
The unique ID of the user
The updated status of the user's account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command changes the status of the specified user from 'Activated' to 'Deactivated'.

maml:description.maml:para: This commands modifies a vendor in the Alero portal.
This command can change the status of a vendor in the Alero portal or the properties. When modifying the properties, all properties must be provided.

maml:Description.maml:para: Token to authenticate to Alero.
The updated status of the vendor's account.
The vendor's unique Id
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Token to authenticate to Alero.
The vendor's unique Id
All vendor properties must be provided.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Token to authenticate to Alero.
The updated status of the vendor's account.
The vendor's unique Id
All vendor properties must be provided.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command deactivates the specified vendor.
The command updates all properties specified in the hashtable object 'updateBody' for the vendor.

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns a list of entries matching the selected actitivities.

This command accepts an array of strings for the ActivityType parameter, which also has auto-complete functionality. Additionally, you need to enter the timespan in a datetime format for the start and end date.

maml:Description.maml:para: Token to authenticate to Alero.
List of Activity Types to retrieve
Start of the period
End of the period
The maximum number of entries to return
The number of entries to skip

Token to authenticate to Alero.
Start of the period
The maximum number of entries to return
The number of entries to skip
End of the period

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all entries of group creation within the last three days.

maml:description.maml:para: The function returns application information from the Alero portal.

Enter the Site Id

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns application information.

maml:description.maml:para: This command retrieves group information.
You can choose to select groups either by string. This may return multiple groups or you can select a single group by ID.

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns all existing sites in the Alero portal.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the first 100 (default value of the $Limit parameter) sites from the Alero portal.
This command returns 50 sites from the Alero portal, starting from the 25th site.

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns user information, either based on a string search or on a unique user ID.
The string search allows also the usage of wildcards. The search applies to the name of the user.

maml:description.maml:para: Creating an authentication token for a service account from CyberArk Alero.

This is an easy-to-use function to create a JWT (JSON Web Token) for authentication to CyberArk Alero. Required is the JSON file containing the private key for the service account, the data center of your tenant and the ID of your tenant. This function has a switch to convert the token to a secure string. The module has one dependency to OpenSSL. The token is valid for 5 minutes.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the path to your service account JSON file.
Select the datacenter of your Alero instance.
Enter the ID your company in Alero.
Returns the token as a secure string.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Returns the token as a secure string.
Select the datacenter of your Alero instance.
Enter the path to your service account JSON file.
Enter the ID your company in Alero.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This functions returns a token.
